plot Module¶

class holoviews.plotting.plot.AdjointLayoutPlot(layout, layout_type, subaxes, subplots, **params)[source]¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.plot.CompositePlot

LayoutPlot allows placing up to three Views in a number of predefined and fixed layouts, which are defined by the layout_dict class attribute. This allows placing subviews next to a main plot in either a ‘top’ or ‘right’ position.

Initially, a LayoutPlot computes an appropriate layout based for the number of Views in the AdjointLayout object it has been given, but when embedded in a NdLayout, it can recompute the layout to match the number of rows and columns as part of a larger grid.

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Boolean latex (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use LaTeX text.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Number border_size (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=0.25, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
The size of the border expressed as a fraction of the main plot.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {group}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param Dict rcparams (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={}, instantiate=True, is_instance=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
matplotlib rc parameters to apply to the figure.
param Number subplot_size (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=0.25, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
The size subplots as expressed as a fraction of the main plot.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, None), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
adjust_positions()[source]¶

Make adjustments to the positions of subplots (if available) relative to the main plot axes as required.

This method is called by LayoutPlot after an initial pass used to position all the Layouts together. This method allows LayoutPlots to make final adjustments to the axis positions.

anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)¶

The new set of ranges is returned.

class holoviews.plotting.plot.CompositePlot(figure=None, axis=None, dimensions=None, layout_dimensions=None, subplots=None, uniform=True, keys=None, subplot=False, **params)[source]¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.plot.Plot

CompositePlot provides a baseclass for plots coordinate multiple subplots to form a Layout.

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Boolean latex (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)

param Dict rcparams (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={}, instantiate=True, is_instance=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)

param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, None), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)¶

Method to return a matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb2838db8>¶
get_param_values(onlychanged=False)¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb2838cb0>¶
inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb2838ba8>¶
message(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a message.

classmethod params(parameter_name=None)¶

Return the Parameters of this class as the dictionary {name: parameter_object}

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

classmethod print_param_defaults()¶

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')¶

Variant of __repr__ designed for generating a runnable script.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb2838b50>¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb2838f70>¶
state_pop()¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_handles(axis, view, key, ranges=None)¶

Should be called by the update_frame class to update any handles on the plot.

verbose(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

class holoviews.plotting.plot.GridPlot(layout, ranges=None, keys=None, dimensions=None, **params)[source]¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.plot.CompositePlot

Plot a group of elements in a grid layout based on a GridSpace element object.

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Boolean latex (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use LaTeX text.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=auto, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Aspect ratios on GridPlot should be automatically determined.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.

param Boolean show_legend (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Legends add to much clutter in a grid and are disabled by default.
param Integer xrotation (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 360), constant=False, default=0, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)

Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.

param Dict rcparams (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={}, instantiate=True, is_instance=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
matplotlib rc parameters to apply to the figure.

class holoviews.plotting.plot.LayoutPlot(layout, **params)[source]¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.plot.CompositePlot

A LayoutPlot accepts either a Layout or a NdLayout and displays the elements in a cartesian grid in scanline order.

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Boolean latex (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use LaTeX text.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param Number vertical_spacing (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=0.2, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Specifies the space between vertically adjacent elements in the grid. Default value is set conservatively to avoid overlap of subplots.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.05, 0.05, 0.95, 0.95), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.

The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb2838cb0>¶
grid_situate(subplots, current_idx, layout_type, subgrid_width)[source]¶

Situate the current AdjointLayoutPlot in a LayoutPlot. The LayoutPlot specifies a layout_type into which the AdjointLayoutPlot must be embedded. This enclosing layout is guaranteed to have enough cells to display all the views.

Based on this enforced layout format, a starting index supplied by LayoutPlot (indexing into a large gridspec arrangement) is updated to the appropriate embedded value. It will also return a list of gridspec indices associated with the all the required layout axes.

inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb2838c58>¶

class holoviews.plotting.plot.Plot(figure=None, axis=None, dimensions=None, layout_dimensions=None, subplots=None, uniform=True, keys=None, subplot=False, **params)[source]¶

Bases: param.parameterized.Parameterized

A Plot object returns either a matplotlib figure object (when called or indexed) or a matplotlib animation object as appropriate. Plots take element objects such as Image, Contours or Points as inputs and plots them in the appropriate format. As views may vary over time, all plots support animation via the anim() method.

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Boolean latex (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use LaTeX text.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {group}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param Dict rcparams (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={}, instantiate=True, is_instance=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
matplotlib rc parameters to apply to the figure.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, None), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)

param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.

The new set of ranges is returned.

raster Module¶

class holoviews.plotting.raster.RasterGridPlot(layout, keys=None, dimensions=None, ranges=None, **params)[source]¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.plot.GridPlot, holoviews.plotting.element.OverlayPlot

RasterGridPlot evenly spaces out plots of individual projections on a grid, even when they differ in size. Since this class uses a single axis to generate all the individual plots it is much faster than the equivalent using subplots.

param Integer xrotation (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 360), constant=False, default=0, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Rotation angle of the xticks.
param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Dict rcparams (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={}, instantiate=True, is_instance=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
matplotlib rc parameters to apply to the figure.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Boolean logx (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to apply log scaling to the x-axis of the Chart.
param Boolean logy (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to apply log scaling to the y-axis of the Chart.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=auto, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Aspect ratios on RasterGridPlot should be automatically determined.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Number border (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=10, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Aggregate border as a fraction of total plot size.
param Boolean invert_xaxis (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to invert the plot x-axis.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, None), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
param ObjectSelector show_yaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=left, instantiate=False, objects=[‘left’, ‘right’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the yaxis.
param Boolean invert_yaxis (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to invert the plot y-axis.
param Integer xticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the x-axis.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param Integer yrotation (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 360), constant=False, default=0, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Rotation angle of the xticks.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to show a Cartesian grid on the plot.
param Boolean latex (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use LaTeX text.
param String tick_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=%.2f, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Formatting string for the GridPlot ticklabels.
param Boolean show_legend (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Legends add to much clutter in a grid and are disabled by default.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {group}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Integer yticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the y-axis.
param ObjectSelector show_xaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=bottom, instantiate=False, objects=[‘top’, ‘bottom’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the xaxis.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)¶

Method to return a matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb3033998>¶
get_param_values(onlychanged=False)¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb3033890>¶
inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb30339f0>¶
message(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a message.

classmethod params(parameter_name=None)¶

Return the Parameters of this class as the dictionary {name: parameter_object}

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

classmethod print_param_defaults()¶

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')¶

Variant of __repr__ designed for generating a runnable script.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb3033940>¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb30335d0>¶
state_pop()¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_handles(axis, view, key, ranges=None)¶

Should be called by the update_frame class to update any handles on the plot.

verbose(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

seaborn Module¶

class holoviews.plotting.seaborn.BivariatePlot(element, keys=None, ranges=None, dimensions=None, overlaid=False, cyclic_index=0, zorder=0, **params)[source]¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.seaborn.FullRedrawPlot

Bivariate plot visualizes two-dimensional kernel density estimates using the Seaborn kdeplot function. Additionally, by enabling the joint option, the marginals distributions can be plotted alongside each axis (does not animate or compose).

param Integer xrotation (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 360), constant=False, default=0, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Rotation angle of the xticks.
param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Dict rcparams (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={}, instantiate=True, is_instance=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
matplotlib rc parameters to apply to the figure.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Enables computing the plot bounds from the data itself. Disabled by default since data is often preprocessed, before display, changing the bounds.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Boolean logx (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to apply log scaling to the x-axis of the Chart.
param Boolean logy (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to apply log scaling to the y-axis of the Chart.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Aspect ratio defaults to square, ‘equal’ or numeric values are also supported.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Boolean invert_xaxis (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to invert the plot x-axis.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, None), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
param ObjectSelector show_yaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=left, instantiate=False, objects=[‘left’, ‘right’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the yaxis.
param Boolean invert_yaxis (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to invert the plot y-axis.
param Integer xticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the x-axis.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param Integer yrotation (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 360), constant=False, default=0, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Rotation angle of the xticks.
param Boolean joint (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to visualize the kernel density estimate with marginal distributions along each axis. Does not animate or compose when enabled.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)

Number of ticks along the y-axis.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

state_pop()¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

verbose(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

class holoviews.plotting.seaborn.DistributionPlot(element, keys=None, ranges=None, dimensions=None, overlaid=False, cyclic_index=0, zorder=0, **params)[source]¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.seaborn.FullRedrawPlot

DistributionPlot visualizes Distribution Views using the Seaborn distplot function. This allows visualizing a 1D array as a histogram, kernel density estimate, or rugplot.

param Integer xrotation (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 360), constant=False, default=0, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Rotation angle of the xticks.

class holoviews.plotting.seaborn.FullRedrawPlot(element, keys=None, ranges=None, dimensions=None, overlaid=False, cyclic_index=0, zorder=0, **params)[source]¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.element.ElementPlot

FullRedrawPlot provides an abstract baseclass, defining an update_frame method, which completely wipes the axis and redraws the plot.

param Integer xrotation (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 360), constant=False, default=0, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Rotation angle of the xticks.
param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Dict rcparams (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={}, instantiate=True, is_instance=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
matplotlib rc parameters to apply to the figure.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Enables computing the plot bounds from the data itself. Disabled by default since data is often preprocessed, before display, changing the bounds.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)

param Boolean logx (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)

Whether to apply log scaling to the y-axis of the Chart.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Aspect ratio defaults to square, ‘equal’ or numeric values are also supported.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Boolean invert_xaxis (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to invert the plot x-axis.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, None), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
param ObjectSelector show_yaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=left, instantiate=False, objects=[‘left’, ‘right’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the yaxis.
param Boolean invert_yaxis (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to invert the plot y-axis.
param Integer xticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the x-axis.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param Integer yrotation (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 360), constant=False, default=0, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Rotation angle of the xticks.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Enables the axis grid.
param Boolean latex (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use LaTeX text.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {group}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Integer yticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the y-axis.
param ObjectSelector show_xaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=bottom, instantiate=False, objects=[‘top’, ‘bottom’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the xaxis.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)¶

Method to return a matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb3200890>¶
get_extents(view, ranges)¶

Gets the extents for the axes from the current View. The globally computed ranges can optionally override the extents.

get_param_values(onlychanged=False)¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb3200cb0>¶
inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb3200c58>¶
message(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a message.

classmethod params(parameter_name=None)¶

Return the Parameters of this class as the dictionary {name: parameter_object}

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

classmethod print_param_defaults()¶

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')¶

Variant of __repr__ designed for generating a runnable script.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb32008e8>¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb3200940>¶
state_pop()¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

verbose(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

class holoviews.plotting.seaborn.RegressionPlot(element, keys=None, ranges=None, dimensions=None, overlaid=False, cyclic_index=0, zorder=0, **params)[source]¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.seaborn.FullRedrawPlot

RegressionPlot visualizes Regression Views using the Seaborn regplot interface, allowing the user to perform and plot linear regressions on a set of scatter points. Parameters to the replot function can be supplied via the opts magic.

param Integer xrotation (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 360), constant=False, default=0, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Rotation angle of the xticks.
param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Dict rcparams (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={}, instantiate=True, is_instance=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
matplotlib rc parameters to apply to the figure.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Enables computing the plot bounds from the data itself. Disabled by default since data is often preprocessed, before display, changing the bounds.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Boolean logx (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to apply log scaling to the x-axis of the Chart.
param Boolean logy (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to apply log scaling to the y-axis of the Chart.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Aspect ratio defaults to square, ‘equal’ or numeric values are also supported.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)

class holoviews.plotting.seaborn.SNSFramePlot(view, **params)[source]¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.pandas.DFrameViewPlot

SNSFramePlot takes an SNSFrame as input and plots the contained data using the set plot_type. This largely mirrors the way DFramePlot works, however, since most Seaborn plot types plot one dimension against another it uses the x and y parameters, which can be set on the SNSFrame.

param ObjectSelector plot_type (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=scatter_matrix, instantiate=False, objects=[‘interact’, ‘regplot’, ‘lmplot’, ‘corrplot’, ‘plot’, ‘boxplot’, ‘hist’, ‘scatter_matrix’, ‘autocorrelation_plot’, ‘pairgrid’, ‘facetgrid’, ‘pairplot’, ‘violinplot’, ‘factorplot’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Selects which Seaborn plot type to use, when visualizing the SNSFrame. The options that can be passed to the plot_type are defined in dframe_options.
param Integer xrotation (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 360), constant=False, default=0, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Rotation angle of the xticks.
param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Dict rcparams (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={}, instantiate=True, is_instance=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
matplotlib rc parameters to apply to the figure.

By default we don’t mess with Pandas based tickmarks

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)¶

The new set of ranges is returned.

class holoviews.plotting.seaborn.TimeSeriesPlot(element, keys=None, ranges=None, dimensions=None, overlaid=False, cyclic_index=0, zorder=0, **params)[source]¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.seaborn.FullRedrawPlot

TimeSeries visualizes sets of curves using the Seaborn tsplot function. This provides functionality to plot error bars with various styles alongside the averaged curve.

param Integer xrotation (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 360), constant=False, default=0, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Rotation angle of the xticks.
param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Dict rcparams (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={}, instantiate=True, is_instance=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
matplotlib rc parameters to apply to the figure.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Enables computing the plot bounds from the data itself. Disabled by default since data is often preprocessed, before display, changing the bounds.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Boolean logx (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to apply log scaling to the x-axis of the Chart.
param Boolean logy (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to apply log scaling to the y-axis of the Chart.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Aspect ratio defaults to square, ‘equal’ or numeric values are also supported.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Boolean invert_xaxis (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to invert the plot x-axis.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, None), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
param ObjectSelector show_yaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=left, instantiate=False, objects=[‘left’, ‘right’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the yaxis.
param Boolean invert_yaxis (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to invert the plot y-axis.
param Integer xticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the x-axis.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Disabled by default for clarity.
param Integer yrotation (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 360), constant=False, default=0, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Rotation angle of the xticks.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Enables the axis grid.
param Boolean latex (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use LaTeX text.
param Boolean show_legend (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to show legend for the plot.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {group}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Integer yticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the y-axis.
param ObjectSelector show_xaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=bottom, instantiate=False, objects=[‘top’, ‘bottom’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the xaxis.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)¶

Method to return a matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb32009f0>¶
get_extents(view, ranges)¶

Gets the extents for the axes from the current View. The globally computed ranges can optionally override the extents.

get_param_values(onlychanged=False)¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb3200ba8>¶
inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb3200940>¶
message(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a message.

classmethod params(parameter_name=None)¶

Return the Parameters of this class as the dictionary {name: parameter_object}

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

classmethod print_param_defaults()¶

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')¶

Variant of __repr__ designed for generating a runnable script.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb3200a48>¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb3200c00>¶
state_pop()¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

verbose(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

tabular Module¶

class holoviews.plotting.tabular.TablePlot(table, **params)[source]¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.element.ElementPlot

A TablePlot can plot both TableViews and ViewMaps which display as either a single static table or as an animated table respectively.

param Integer max_value_len (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=20, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
The maximum allowable string length of a value shown in any table cell. Any strings longer than this length will be truncated.
param Integer xrotation (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 360), constant=False, default=0, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Rotation angle of the xticks.
param Integer float_precision (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=3, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
The floating point precision to use when printing float numeric data types.
param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Dict rcparams (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={}, instantiate=True, is_instance=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
matplotlib rc parameters to apply to the figure.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Boolean logx (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to apply log scaling to the x-axis of the Chart.
param Boolean logy (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to apply log scaling to the y-axis of the Chart.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Number border (allow_None=False, bounds=(0.0, 0.5), constant=False, default=0.05, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
The fraction of the plot that should be empty around the edges.
param Boolean invert_xaxis (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to invert the plot x-axis.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, None), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
param ObjectSelector show_yaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=left, instantiate=False, objects=[‘left’, ‘right’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the yaxis.
param Boolean invert_yaxis (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to invert the plot y-axis.

Number of ticks along the x-axis.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.

Rotation angle of the xticks.
param Integer max_font_size (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=12, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
The largest allowable font size for the text in each table cell.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to show a Cartesian grid on the plot.
param Dict font_types (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={‘heading’: <matplotlib.font_manager.FontProperties object at 0x2b5ca12f6b90>}, instantiate=True, is_instance=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The font style used for heading labels used for emphasis.
param Boolean latex (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use LaTeX text.

The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Integer max_rows (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=15, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
The maximum number of Table rows before the table is summarized.
param Integer yticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)

param ObjectSelector show_xaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=bottom, instantiate=False, objects=[‘top’, ‘bottom’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the xaxis.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)¶

Method to return a matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

Gets the extents for the axes from the current View. The globally computed ranges can optionally override the extents.

get_param_values(onlychanged=False)¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb201d208>¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b5cb201d260>¶
state_pop()¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

verbose(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.
